title: NO WAY TO REQUEST HELP
text: God forbid you have a problem that isn‚Äôt already in their FAQ section, that‚Äôs ALL you can refer to when you need help! Can‚Äôt speak to a person, can‚Äôt email or chat with someone, there‚Äôs not even a chat-bot that will run your message through an algorithm and suggest articles that may be vaguely relevant to your question. I can understand that running a call center would be pricey for such a successful company üôÑ but surely you have humans in there somewhere that could be bothered to reply to an email every once in a while. I won‚Äôt request a trip unless I know for sure I can ride, but how the hell could I possibly know that if the only human contact I would get is by contacting the driver who will just hit ‚Äúcancel trip‚Äù to avoid all the hoops that we‚Äôd have to jump through to contact uber through the Driver App (if that‚Äôs even possible, I wouldn‚Äôt know, but I see online it says there‚Äôs an option for Drivers).

title: Wait for a Ride Was Too Too Long
text: Today leaving the Golden Gate Bridge I called an Uber. It said it would take 19 minutes for someone to arrive. We were happy to wait that long. But, 30 minutes plus later it still said 19 minutes. I wasn‚Äôt able to call driver directly, or the number I called, no one picked up. I kept messaging the driver asking if she was still coming. No answer after four texts. Finally, the app updated to say that driver was 8 minutes away. Yeah! But, then the driver cancelled. Really? After waiting over 30 minutes the driver cancelled with no explanation, no text, nothing! So, we were rerouted for a different driver. He was fabulous. But, I think Uber should reimburse me for waiting an hour and having a rude driver that cancelled with NO explanation. That‚Äôs crappy service.  And I think Brooke with a Chevrolet Tahoe License Plate 8EQD599 shouldn‚Äôt be accepting trips and cancelling them 30 minutes later with no explanation.

title: Impossible To Contact Humans
text: I have used Uber for years and thus my login info was ancient. I got the new iPhone and today tried to use Uber. It requires login and I have no idea what the password was. Using the automated help I discovered several things starting with the fact the email address I signed up with is one I deleted years ago. Eventually I found a place to change email addresses. I filled it out and it informed me it sent a verification email to the old closed account. There is no way to speak or write a human being just the AI idiocy. I can‚Äôt create a new account because my phone already is registered. Deleting the app and reinstalling doesn‚Äôt help because it doesn‚Äôt pay attention to your Apple ID email or I never would have had a problem. Most apps read your email and phone from your phone. Uber isn‚Äôt that intelligent. Long ago I had to make my trip today so I ended up having to create a Lyft account and use them. I guess I‚Äôm done with Uber since they make it impossible for me to use them or to get human help. One more company that just wants cheap illegal immigrants for help and AI rather than providing jobs for people here legally. Lyft wins.

title: Useless
text:
With Uber there is no one to contact when there‚Äôs an issue.  There have  been several times where the uber Driver was really late or didn‚Äôt show up or couldn‚Äôt find me and then I would get charged. It shouldn‚Äôt be my problem if the uber driver can‚Äôt find my address Or it takes 30 minutes when its says it will take 4 min on my app and he keeps getting delayed. I should be able to cancel without a fee and get another driver instead of waiting 30 min or longer. I accept it because the app say 4-7 mins. or else I‚Äôll find alternative transportation so im not late. Absurd that I get charged a cancellation fee when the issue lies with circumstances where I am not at fault.  At least with Lyft you can contact them to let them know the situation so the charge can be reversed. I only continue to use Uber because lyft isn‚Äôt  available in Mexico or many other places. But of course Uber probably doesn‚Äôt care and they probably won‚Äôt do anything to fix this. 
I would have let them know directly but since there is no way to contact them this is my only way of letting them know.

title: Share ride
text:
I understand doing share a ride is an economical way to go. But the new set up of picking you in different spot and dropping you close to where you final destination is I don‚Äôt like. If you would let us know ahead of time what the actual ride would include, gives the consumer an option to either take Uber or just get a cab or walk to your final destination.  
I was disappointed with my last ride. Nothing to do with the driver, but the application. My ride was a total of 7 blocks from my pick up point to final destination. Your application make me walk 4 out of the 7 blocks. If I knew ahead of time that that was going to happen, I would of chose to walk the 7 blocks instead or get a cab for door to door service and the price would have been about the same. Very disappointed with this new share ride application and having to meet the driver in different spot and drop you off in deferent spot.

title: My Trip with my driver phyllis
text:
I had a very challenging day with some of the events that happened,  as my vehicle was towed, and I had to use Uber this evening.  I was so stressed out.  My driver, Phyllis arrived to pick me up to begin my journey.  I just want to tell you that she was absolutely amazing.  We had to spend close to almost two hours together in the vehicle and it literally went by as if I was only in the car for 30 minutes.  She was a great driver, Her car was immaculate, and we had fabulous conversation the entire time.  She had a fabulous personality which intern relaxed me, and made my very stressful day end on a positive note.  

We are very lucky to have her as an employee, and anyone that does get to have her as their driver will be extremely lucky.  Thank you Uber for sending her to me, as I hope she gets to see this, and thank you, Phyllis for being as fabulous as you were.

RoseAnn

title: Uber doesn‚Äôt care about anything but money!!
text: In 1 week I‚Äôve experienced two major issues with Uber and have no recourse. My son left his phone in an Uber and 6 days later the driver is still dodging him. Uber is no help at all. Ridiculously hard to contact and when they do the respond it is like it‚Äôs from a robot. I‚Äôm disgusted with how this driver has abused my son and Uber offers no help. They hide behind technology!! No humans answering phones and helping!! Then I call an Uber to go home from a party and after my ride is accepted the driver calls me to ask where I am and where I‚Äôm going. Once he determined where I was going he chose to back out of the ride. I was waiting 15 minutes for this ride and I lived 15 minutes away. He wasted my time and made me feel like I did something wrong. I think it‚Äôs time Uber get its act together or the government regulates it even more. I will not use Uber again from this point and will make sure my story is heard by others. They don‚Äôt have a clue and don‚Äôt care!! One driver steals my sons phone and another ditches me after I‚Äôm waiting 15 minutes. I hope others join me in showing Uber they need to treat the customer with respect.

title: The new uber update is unfair to drivers & riders alike
text: Since the new update for the uber app, the pool feature has become unreasonable for both drivers & riders. I am a frequent user of the platform for taxi rides. Since the update, I find that the app will have riders & drivers being forced to leave locations, which they have to pass anyways to a destination, in order to meet the other party. A perfect scenario of this is when I had a destination set for a certain block. Instead of being dropped at my requested location, I was taken 3 blocks away. It was my observation that the gps then told the driver to drive past my requested drop off point on the way to the next location. I know the driver had to pass this point because I requested to stay in the car, since I saw he was passing my location ANYWAY. Uber has created a new, very unsatisfactory system. I make this review based on experiences from 10+ uber pool trips at different locations & times. This new system is outrageous. The system was better before this recent update which included walking to/from destinations. The walking creates an inconvenience & confusion for uber pool drivers & customers alike.

title: VOMIT SCAM
text: So I recently was hung out at my friends house and had a lot to drink so my friend ordered an uber for me.  Everything seemed fine when I got back to where I live another friend came down to help me get up to my room. A week goes past and my friend who ordered me the uber gets chargers 150$ for ‚Äúvomit‚Äù however MANY THINGS DONT ADD UP. Let‚Äôs start with the ride, he took a path that added an extra minutes to get me back, but my friend noticed and received 3$ back from it. He sent a picture of what seemed like a good amount of vomit on the ground and little on door where the cup holder is.... however my friend who helped me didn‚Äôt notice it and i didn‚Äôt have a single drop of throw up on me including my pants and shoes!  But wait there more, this took place at night, but the picture he sent was during the day and the vomit was still fresh looking, weird right?? My friend who ordered the uber filed a complaint saying that this doesn‚Äôt seem right hopefully uber takes care of the issue because this is fraud.  Uber you need to have something in place where people can‚Äôt get scammed for doing the ‚Äúsafe‚Äù thing and not driving while drunk. Please fix this issue!

title: Bad navigation/nonexistent customer service
text: I don‚Äôt tend to use Uber that much when I‚Äôm at home since I have a car, but I use it often when I travel. The navigation has been really crazy lately, the other night I was stuck in the car for two hours due to traffic that could have easily been rerouted. The driver was only following the instructions on his GPS, but that navigation system should have instructed him to avoid the traffic jam. When I got home from my trip I tried to use Uber to get home from the train station which has designated drop off/pickup areas, and when I requested the ride the driver kept going in circles and eventually cancelled the trip and was hit with a $6 fee. No phone call, no communication. I tried to communicate this to Uber but there is literally no line to them via any email, chat, phone or ANYTHING. I was credited the fee, but it‚Äôs a matter of principle at this point. Why is it my fault that the driver couldn‚Äôt find the designated area? Why couldn‚Äôt the driver just call me? Not a very pleasant experience.

title: Absolute madness
text: So I got a new phone, same number, im here at work with no ride home, hoping i can use uber to get home, but nope, it wont allow me to order my ride even though my number and credit card is setup because im still logged on uber on my old broken phone, with the same exact phone number. Im the same person, i did everything I can it just says we‚Äôll get someone to help you shortly but no one ever has. This is unacceptable beyond belief, this is my ride home and i cant use it because it says my phone number is already in use on the phone with that same exact number, what the heck!!!! I was luckily able to get a ride from my brother whos about to go to work, otherwise i wouldve literally been stuck here with no ride, thanks to uber. This is the last time Im ever using uber because if i cant use it to get a ride, whats the point. Debating on deleting the app because this is ridiculous. Probably no one will see this and this will never get to anyone‚Äôs attention, im so furious right now, im just relieved I was able to find a ride from someone else or I‚Äôd literally be stuck here with no ride and would have to walk home 5 miles in the hot Texas sun.

title: Love love love uber, just some small issues
text:
Uber is great, I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs saved countless lives getting drunk drivers off the road. I would suggest the app even if the UI/UX was garbage (which it isn‚Äôt). If I had to ‚Äúreview‚Äù it however, I would say the maps need updating. There are roads that have changed, not so recently, from two-way to one-way. Signs installed that redirect traffic permanently, etc. As an app that focuses entirely on driving, routes, and maximising driver efficiency, staying on top of such things would be paramount. Maybe take a waze approach and have drivers submit closures & outdated routes. Not sure, you can do the r&d. 

That‚Äôs me being nit picky tho, uber could be a terrible interface and I would still use it. Safe, kind drivers, quick, and easy to sort. 

Side note, uber take 25% of the fare? Seems a bit much for a massive tech giant. Remember that your drivers have kids, hobbies, lives... without them uber wouldn't exist. Generosity goes a long way in the eye of the the 99%.

title: All around pretty good
text:
All around, Uber is decent. Although I‚Äôve noticed lately my drivers haven‚Äôt been the safest by on the road, and often times their cars smell very overpowering, like cigarettes or air fresheners. It might seem picky, but it‚Äôs gross to me. 

I really wish there was a way to favorite certain drivers so I can request them in the future. I googled this and apparently the feature is available in certain locations. It would be great if they open this feature to everyone.

I also noticed that the cost of the ride goes up if I don‚Äôt reserve the ride initially. Today I opened the app and my ride was $12. I closed the app and when I reopened it, the cost doubled to $24. I was annoyed and closed the app for a few minutes. When I opened it a third time, the cost went up to $44. I immediately closed it and downloaded Lyft. Within a few minutes I got a notification that my ride cost dropped below $14. These kinds of price games are cringey and I‚Äôm not having it. Do better Uber.

title: Horrible customer service
text: I‚Äôve been having an issue recently with my family profile.  My wife and kids have not been able to order a ride and the message is ‚Äúoops something went wrong, please choose a valid payment option‚Äù.  After troubleshooting the issue myself and unsuccessful, I reached out to uber for help.  First of all, there is not a customer support phone number so you have to type in your issue and wait for a response (7 hours was the longest wait).  I‚Äôve received several responses back and none of the suggestions have worked .  My family can still not order rides.  I find it interesting that the responders do not read the thread because I‚Äôm getting the same suggestion (a fact that I‚Äôve pointed out already). I‚Äôm wondering now if at some point I‚Äôll be given a phone number to call.  This seems like a very simple issue to fix.  I‚Äôm very disappointed with this experience.

title: Trip from airport to our hotel
text:
First driver showed up on time but his car couldn‚Äôt cary my folding wheel chair and luggage. Nice man but did not speak english. A Spanish speaking lady helped us with the translation. I needed to cancel his   ride so he could get back to work and I needed to get a Xl to cary my stuff. 
A very nice man named Otto who spoke very little English picked us up and took us to the wrong Hotel. Fortunately, we did not unload our luggage and wheelchair until I found out what‚Äôs wrong what is our. We were at the wrong hotel, so he drove us to the correct hotel, which was right by the airport. Oh yeah and auto is a very courteous man, but I think I ended up paying for a long trip hotel was close to the airport. I was very careful when I put in the name of the hotel and make sure I have the right one. I don‚Äôt know what happened. I gave the first driver a six dollar tip because he had to wait till I figured out how to cancel my trip. I think I overpaid to get to the correct hotel. That was close to the airport and then the ended up paying. Two tips just didn‚Äôt seem fair.

title: What do we pay for?
text: I don‚Äôt know about anybody else, but when I pay extra money out of my pocket to get to a location I expect to GET TO THE LOCATION! This update Uber has with having to walk to meet your driver is inconvenient and sometimes very confusing depending on the area you‚Äôre in. The drivers are often rude and not helpful in locating them, instead they will just cancel on you. The GPS takes the LONGEST routes and a lot of street names on the map do not even match the current street names! I recently requested an Uber pool and not only did the driver arrive ahead of time, he ignored my first call and sent me a text that he had arrived. The. After wondering around and calling him again and informing him that we could not find the street he was on he just said ‚Äúoh I don‚Äôt know‚Äù, hung up and canceled the ride! I‚Äôve been in a pools where women with babies have been dropped off in the middle of the night with bags blocks away from their destination. The walking update needs to be taken off and the GPS needs to be updated. This is not the first time I‚Äôve had a problem with Uber drivers or trips. This just isn‚Äôt how you treat loyal paying customers!

title: Pool modification
text:
The pool is a great option if you‚Äôre on a budget, however I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair for the person driving or convenient for the persons pooling to drive backwards after the driver picked up a passenger in a certain location. For example, the driver picks me up, the driver drives several blocks and then gets a request for pick up further back from where I was originally picked up. It‚Äôs not prudent for the passengers or the driver. 
Second, in the pool, let‚Äôs say the driver already has 2 passengers and  I will be the third one to be picked up, let the driver drop off everyone according to the pick up AND THEN allow drivers to pick up more passengers after that. We are all in a time crunch regardless of the trip. Please modify this feature!

Also, pay your drivers a little better! Most conversations I have with drivers is about how they don‚Äôt get paid enough. Okay, it‚Äôs cheap for us, but at least pay them at least a set rate and the rides be additional compensation. Come on, Uber. We all know your top CEOs make good money - pay them better and perhaps we‚Äôll find drivers in better moods!

title: Couldn‚Äôt Return My Lost Item
text: Uber Does Not Even Desire A Star Because The Fact That A Customer representative told Me ‚Äú Uber Is Not Responsible for any Lost‚Äù But In The App You Guise Are Claiming To Help People Find There Stuff. Why Have A Section Saying Loss An Found Then Say To A Uber Customer The Company is Not Responsible for Any Lost Your Very Dumb An I‚Äôll advise anybody Don‚Äôt take Uber There The Worst Transportation company I Ever Deal With You Guise Should Install ‚ÄúLYFT‚Äù instead of Uber because The Amount of Stuff That Happen To Me While Taking Uber Is The Worst Experience anybody should Have To Go Through. Also Some Of These Uber Driver Dint Even Have Manners like A Uber I Took Yesterday A Man Name Mohammad  got picked up no Manner, No Social Chat Nothing An To Top It Off He Didn‚Äôt Even Make A Effort To Return My Backpack With My debit card An Other Important documents ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Im Sorry To Say But I‚Äôm Never Taking A Uber Ever In My Life üë®üèΩ‚Äçü¶Øüë®üèΩ‚Äçü¶Øüë®üèΩ‚Äçü¶Øüë®üèΩ‚Äçü¶Ø

title: One Bad Apple...
text:
I‚Äôve been using Uber for over a year and have had many great drivers.  I usually give them 5 stars.  It takes only one to spoil it.  

Today, December 21st at about 6:15pm I requested an Uber at the Plaza Bonita Mall in Chula Vista.  Due to your four listings of stores that did not match my location, I attempted to call the driver, Julia, twice.   Let me give you the picture, we were tired, my daughter-in-law, one year-old grandson, and me.  Finally, I was able to text her to give her our exact location.  The parking lot was congested, so drivers were having a tough time navigating through it.

When Julia arrived, we first placed the baby in the car so we could then load our other stuff.  I told Julia I tried calling her twice to update my location, but her phone was off. Because I said this in a matter of fact tone, she asked if I wanted another driver.  I told her, no I was good.  She again asked and I said no.  She then said, You need to get another Uber.  I told her, ‚Äúreally, you are kicking out a one year old, too?‚Äù  Unbelievable. I did tell her she had no business being an Uber driver.  

Too bad for her.  I always tip generously and find the best in drivers to give them 5 stars.  

I can‚Äôt imagine what she would do if she had a real challenge on her hands.  You cannot teach people compassion or empathy, so maybe she needs to move on.  

So disappointed.

title: Great for what it does, but missing some key features
text: The app does a great job of doing live updates, and telling me where to meet my driver. But if I wanted to change my updated pickup location it doesn‚Äôt feel intuitive. There‚Äôs no button that says ‚Äúedit pickup location‚Äù or at least it doesn‚Äôt feel that way. What I assume are buttons doesn‚Äôt appear so. As well as another feature for which I think would be great. For example, if I wanted to share the details of a ride to someone, it only gives them the route access instead of giving them information like when the driver is arriving, who‚Äôs in the car with them, and things of that nature. I want to give rides to friends of mine and if I share status to them they can‚Äôt see when the ride is coming. So I don‚Äôt really see why the share button gives the limited information. It doesn‚Äôt help when I‚Äôm not with someone I want to order an Uber for. Aside from this, the app is great. But not perfect

title: Lost item
text:
Uber 
Who refunds you for a trip and then charges you for it the next day? I have had the absolute hardest time contacting someone who wasn‚Äôt sending me an automatic message. I messaged Uber for I don‚Äôt know how long before they realized what the actual issue was and stopped telling me to do what I ALREADY DID OVER AND OVER! To top that, they do not have a customer service line. Doesn‚Äôt exist, not for passengers anyway. Unprofessional and absolutely not worth the headache. They let just anyone be a driver and put no real thought into their customers. Just another money scam. Uber is a joke. They should make some real changes. 
For anyone using uber, DO NOT LET ONE OF YOUR PASSENGERS LOSE SOMETHING IN THE VEHICLE. This has been an absolute nightmare. Between having to relay messages back and forth between uber and my friend who lost the item because, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the account holder‚Äù Being refunded my money but it being taken right back out with an additional $15 item return fee. (The item isn‚Äôt mine) How can you recharge a refund? Like so many questions and no real answers. I‚Äôve had the worst experiences with drivers using this app, just some really disgusting people driving for uber.

title: Charged multiple times
text: I feel so frustrated! I‚Äôve already reported the same incident every other month yet nothing happened. I‚Äôve got exhausted through their customer service, so I just let it pass through. I gave it a chance. But upon checking recently my bank statements, I couldn‚Äôt believe that they‚Äôve charged me twice, thrice, and even 4x for a single ride. I‚Äôve contacted customer service, they‚Äôve just told me that it was because of the authorization fee and they put it on hold and it was voided. When honestly, it really did go through my account and it was clearly deducted. And they‚Äôve said that they don‚Äôt have any controls to that. (??) I‚Äôve even sent them screenshots from my bank account and they just told me that maybe someone from my household were also using my account. Impossible! Cause none of my family members nor my friends rides uber than ME, MYSELF & I. And they also said that those charges were from the past rides I‚Äôve been in, maybe? Loool! When in fact, the past rides has also been deducted through my account already. Horrible! I couldn‚Äôt believe that one ride will cost you 3x. How?! Why is it like that?!

title: Uber review
text: I like using Uber because the app works efficiently the only problem I have is that sometimes the drivers are not polite and they don‚Äôt wait the proper time that they instructed to I had a problem recently when I was walking up to the car and they weren‚Äôt picking up the phone when I was trying to contact them and them in the driver and had drove off and then I was charge five dollars for cancellation fee that I was not reimbursed for it was not my fault. Another problem I had was the Uber driver was taking a longer route and then what are you to be expected and I was late for my appointment and I told him to go the way that I needed him to go but he refused to and said that he uses the GPS and I was late for my appointment that was very important and I didn‚Äôt end up getting the job for because of being tardy. Other than those two times I‚Äôve never had a big problem with them Uber I use it a lot and hopefully the more times I use it the more benefits I‚Äôve should be gaining from this like maybe discounts on rides

title: Pretty Good
text: There are quite a few things about the Uber app / service that are awesome. Normal transactions are effortless and I really enjoy the experience. When there are issues that need to be resolved, things get complicated and the path to resolution is unclear. I had purchased a coupon for my son who is living in Toronto with the impression that it could be used in Canada based on the description provided on the page where the coupon was purchased. Unfortunately, it can not. After multiple phone calls and emails to Uber and their 3rd party by myself and my son, we were unable to convert the coupon for use in Canada and I was unable to get my money back. The process we went through was very difficult to navigate and the result is less than satisfactory. In spite of this, I still give the service and the app 4 out of 5 stars because the normal experience is so good. A little better customer service on handling issues would result in a 5 star rating from me.

title: Putting in a reservation was pointless
text: I had an important dinner to get to tonight with a reservation at 5pm. To ensure I got there on time I put in a reservation HOURS before I had to be picked up. Pretty early on I got a notification with who my driver would be and I felt secure in getting there on time. As it got closer to when I was going to be picked up I hadn‚Äôt received any additional notifications that my driver was on the way or to be ready, so I checked back into the app to see my driver‚Äôs progress. When I opened the app though‚Ä¶it said it was STILL looking for drivers and that there were none available. At this point it was just about 10mins before I had to leave. THANK GOODNESS that Lyft has priority pick up, and was able to get a driver to me in minutes while I cancelled my Uber reservation. Had I waited for Uber to figure it out‚Ä¶I probably would have been late for my dinner (which I‚Äôm still cutting it close because I had to cancel my Uber and find a different ride). I write this review from the back of a Lyft right this moment, thankful that I‚Äôll at least make it within five mins of my reservation.

title: Pay later. If you can find a driver
text:
I like that if there are issues with a payment method you can pay for a ride later but sadly nobody in this massive city drives for Uber. You need more drivers!

Update: I am now a driver myself and I‚Äôm happy with the app with the exception of the navigation not having any means of mentioning landmarks to make turns easier. Such as ‚Äúafter this light‚Äù or ‚Äúbefore the next intersection‚Äù like other gps apps offer. 
It would also be nice if the riders knew that we (the drivers) are self employed and not employees of Uber. That‚Äôs a common misconception and they believe that what one driver does we all have to do. I hate having poorly behaved kids in my car and avoid school hours because of it. I get a lot of push back from people when I refuse to take unattended minors or insist they‚Äôre in the proper car seats, or even when I ask that they stop kicking the seats or doors of the car I just bought. Smh.

title: Not reliable and forget about satisfaction
text: Uber encourages you to schedule your ride so as not to worry about missing flights or meetings. We scheduled an Uber to pick us up and take us to the airport. Our Uber never showed and we were stranded trying to catch our flight. Trying to contact someone at Uber to express your frustration is an act of perseverance. These technology companies do not want to speak to anyone to defend their accountability. I refused to give up and I finally got through to Uber through social media. Uber‚Äôs excuse was that their policy is letting you know that if your scheduled Uber does not show up 10 minutes after the scheduled arrival time they will notify you that the Uber is not showing up! We already knew that the Uber was not showing up and that we now desperately have to scramble to figure out how to get to the airport. Uber‚Äôs apology was giving us a $5 credit to make up for missing a flight and trying to catch another flight at a great inconvenience and cost. Uber added insult to injury. We now no longer use Uber!

title: Unreliable, uneven experience, terrible customer service at company level
text: I have had some truly great drivers, and some scary incompetent ones. My biggest problem is that their driver app gives incorrect directions to my house that makes it impossible for them to reach me. This is either easily remedied by sending instructions to the driver, but only if they understand English and pay attention to written directions...which is 50/50. Otherwise they just give up and cancel on me. Leaving me to go running up and down a street at 5 am because I‚Äôm going to miss my flight. One would think you could just let the company know that there is a problem with their app‚Äôs directions. Ha! You can‚Äôt access customer service whatsoever if the driver ditches you because of this bug in their app. If you figure out a way to get through to their CS you quickly learn there is no one there interested in solving problems. They tell me to ‚Äúmake sure I‚Äôm connected to the internet‚Äù. This is after four consecutive messages describing the problem in detail. Gee, so grateful they put all the taxis out of business.

title: Getting worse‚Äîway way too long of walks! ):
text: I used to love Uber and found it super useful. A lot of people didn‚Äôt like the addition of ‚ÄúUber Express Pool,‚Äù but I thought it was a great affordable way to commute around the city and made sense; unfortunately, with a recent update a little while ago, the ‚Äúshort walks‚Äù for express pool went from an acceptable 2-4 minutes to being up to 7 or 8 minutes sometimes! It‚Äôs one thing to have people walk a few blocks to make it easier for the driver‚Äôs route and save time, but when it gets to being that long of a walk, what is the point of ride? I understand I can change to normal Uber pool, but at this point the prices for that have become so inflated because of the addition of express pool that for someone who used to use Uber nearly every day, it‚Äôs becoming impossible to afford. It probably has something to do with GPS algorithm or something, but regardless, that change has made me stop using Uber and switch to lyft a lot more often.. hoping this can be fixed soon...!

title: James is the best Uber driver
text:
Tonight I was scared for my life. I‚Äôll call three Uber drivers from Pittsburgh which one was name Mohammed there was a chance I could‚Äôve been rate anything could happen to me. He denied me. I called another one I didn‚Äôt get his name he told me no he would not come get me. He told me to walk to him where I was at the comfort inn in Steubenville Pike he told me to walk downtown closer to him and I asked him could you cancel my ride he told me no I call one more time and James was like an angel he made sure I got home not only did he take me home he cared about my well-being. He talk to me all the way through 
What I have been through I was scared for my life, he is the best Uber driver that I‚Äôve ever ever experienced in my whole time of driving Uber‚Äôs He was like an angel to me. He talk to me in such a honorable way. He made me forget all my problems and I wanna say thank you James foreverything.

title: Why is there ALWAYS a toll charge. Wait time chargeüò°
text: I am tired of always being charged about a $3 toll charge, especially when we have NEVER jumped on a toll road to go to one of my destinations or have I seen a driver taking a toll road to pick me up. Also, this last trip I was waiting 9 mins of an 11 min wait when suddenly my drive canceled the pickup and the replacement Uber driver was again 11 mins away. Then he drove into a parking lot off the street he was supposed to pick me up and then I was charged an $.85 charge for ‚Äúwait time‚Äù! What about my wait time from first driver and then this guy going into parking lot instead of further down street to address of where I was waiting? I‚Äôve stopped tipping because of these fees. Not sure who is getting them. Did my getting 30% off have something to do with first driver bailing on me? Frustrated with Uber! Thinking I will download Lift app. and give them a try.

title: Prices are way too high for no reason
text: I get it it‚Äôs a pandemic and ppl need money but a cab ride from Brooklyn to the Bronx should not be $70+ that‚Äôs ridiculous when before the pandemic it was like around $50 sometimes less and not only that the drivers like to change the price of your rides after they‚Äôve been completed and charge you more than what the asking price was. Not to mention the take the longest route possible to take more money from you and when you suggest an alternative route they all come up with this lie talking about Uber would give them a warning if they do it and they could lose their job with them which isn‚Äôt true in the slightest. Normal rides that used to cost $10-$20 are now costing $20- $30 and it makes no sense. And don‚Äôt even get me started on Uber Pass I pay $30 a month for them to only take $3-$4 off the asking price like how is that any better than before you might as well pay full price. Long story short Uber needs to fix this I‚Äôve spent too much money for them to be stealing money from ppl and overcharging everyone spending money with them

title: Unprofessional!!
text: I take a uber ride every morning to work. I was 15 minutes late to work due to the app not working, uber failed to let me know the ride wasn‚Äôt available even 15 minutes outside my pickup window. Then when addressed about it the only solution uber has is to request your rides 30minutes early to give yourself enough time. Stupidest suggestion ever because i always give myself 40-50 minutes of time frame before my actual start time. Disappointing uber cant take responsibility, AND blames the riders for THEIR mistakes. Not to mention, the last 2 weeks my card has been ran 2-3 different times for an authorization hold when the ride was only requested ONCE & still didnt even give me the ride, putting the money in my acct on hold making me unable to even catch a lyft. And of course support always acts as if they cant find the charge because its only being ‚Äúauthorized & held‚Äù NOT THE POINT. YOU SHOULDNT BE RUNNING ANYONES CARD MORE THAN ONCE WITHOUT PERMISSION, thats known as UNAUTHORIZED!! The past few weeks have been nothing but problematic. NOT HAPPY AT ALL. & this will not be the last heard of it. Very unprofessional. Definitely thinking of making Lyft my goto!

title: Scammer Drivers Unprofessional
text: Some drivers purposely take wrong exits and drive farther to get paid more, it's being several times that I call drivers attention because they take more than 1 wrong exit or turn and they always blame it either on me or the app. They mostly claim that the app is glitching or "told them to do so" but its clearly a lie since I also get the route that Uber is recommending. I wish that Uber would go back to giving ONE stable price and not charge the rider for little extra miles since it's not our fault the driver takes wrong turns or exits. After all, the driver is WORKING, it's a job, they should be professional enough to not constantly be taking wrong turns and exits since Uber tells them when and where to do so. I would like for Uber to ask before charging me if I allowed this extra miles that the driver took. They have "add or change" for a reason and if I didn't add nor changed destination then it's obvious I didn't allowed it.

title: Way Too Many Authorization Charges
text:
I‚Äôve been using Uber for a while now and the one thing that I will never understand are the consistent authorization charges for almost every trip! Is it really necessary to charge me 2 times for the same trip? I use a specific account for my rides to help budget my expenses for the week. I put a certain amount into this account every week depending on my schedule for the week. One time I put money in this account and shortly after requested a ride. Everything went fine! I go to request a ride home and my card was declined. Confused i look at my account and see 3 pending authorization charges plus the ride that was taken! How does this happen?! One charge is bad enough but 3 plus the ride?! I had to put even more money in the account just to get home. What if that was my last? What if I budgeted down to the very last cent?! 
Lyft doesn‚Äôt have all of these unnecessary authorization charges so whats Ubers excuse?!!!!! If Lyft had the same ride pass benefits I would switch in a heartbeat.

title: Annoyed
text: I am so annoyed this morning I requested an Uber. As soon as I got assigned a driver it said 2 mins away. Mind you I‚Äôm leaving my  house at this point to meet the driver and as soon as I was walking to the pick up point I let the driver know I‚Äôll be right there. As soon as I was walking towards the car he canceled my ride. You all should actually call the passenger before canceling because I was literally right there. I have a baby and was walking as fast as I can, I can‚Äôt run to the driver and you all don‚Äôt know everyone‚Äôs situation. Maybe you should actually think about that if we passengers can‚Äôt leave to you ahead of time to meet the driver until we have confirmation of the pickup spot. If you a driver are literally 2 mins away from a pickup point give someone time to walk TO YOU. Especially if I LET YOU KNOW that I‚Äôll be right there. I watched the car drive away. This is really annoying especially if we have to walk to the driver. Give me a heads up before canceling my ride. This really messed up my mood for the day.

title: Confusing and Frustrating
text:
Ordered a ride and it showed me the driver and his vehicle on the map and said he was 4 minutes away. Then the car kept getting further and further away going in the wrong direction. Soon he was more than 15 minutes away! I was going to cancel the ride but it said I would be charged. Since we had theater tickets and had to get there on time, I was getting my car keys when suddenly the program said there was a different driver who was 3 minutes away. This driver did pick us up and he said that the program does that all the time and that I should not cancel a trip because I get charged for cancelling. 
Another issue is that the driver followed the maps program making us go out of the way and delaying our arrival. He said that this was also typical and didn‚Äôt cancel any concern. 
Fortunately the trip back was much better. The driver had the same issue with the map showing and out of the way route but this driver took my direction and we were home in 5 minutes.

title: Uber Support will forget about you
text: I have a 5 star rating and just needed uber support to fix the scheduling option on my app. they keep telling me i might not have this option in my area, but my wife uses the app as well and has the scheduling option (and she is literally sitting right next to me). i also have the most updated ios, the most recent update to the uber app and have deleted and reinstalled and restarted my phone multiple times. it has been nearly a month without any solid feedback. all i ask is for an email update here and then (just to let me know they are still actually working on my issue), but they give the same canned email answers. ive asked for a team lead to respond, but i get the same robotic canned answer. if i didnt give an update every once in a while to my clients until resolution, id be terminated!! i would also lose the business of that client (trust and honesty is key!!) i need the scheduling option for some days, how difficult is it to resolve this issue on their own app? ... perhaps Lyft treats customers better... time to take my business elsewhere, as well as the business of all my coworkers!!!

title: Needs help
text: Normally use Uber for work or going to the store. I‚Äôve been using it for a while now. The past month has been terrible! Charging me a different price than what I was offered in the beginning, giving me three different drivers and charging me for all three when none of them show. Taking a route that is way longer than necessary. These are just a few. Someone else mentioned the fact that they speak English but end up with a driver that doesn‚Äôt understand or speak English - this has been a problem as well. I‚Äôm not sure what happened in the past month or so but the service is not what it used to be. Most of the time there isn‚Äôt a problem. The issues I have listed have happened within the past month to me and to my husband. We needed to call a local cab company because none of those three uber drivers showed yet we were charged for three rides. Extremely disappointed. We will be taking a break for a bit. Hope to see these issues corrected in the very near future.

title: My ride to airport yesterday afternoon, Risa Yudkowitz
text: You sent me a guy who did not know where he was going. He came late because he arrived at the wrong location and argued with me that he was at my location but I told him I was outside he‚Äôs in the wrong place. After arguing with him back and forth he finally put on his google maps and got to my location. I was worried about making my flight and started to panic. Then on the way to the airport I told him where to turn on rock away turnpike but he wouldn‚Äôt listen to me and got on the highway which made us even later. At that point I couldn‚Äôt even speak. They almost refused to take my luggage and I was so distraught that the man took pity on me. I really should have been there at least a half hr earlier and everything would have been fine. In any case my first experience with Uber was awful and I told my friend Fred who convinced me to try it, ‚Äúnever again‚Äù. You gave me a new young driver who didn‚Äôt know his way around that location. You asked me to tip him and I don‚Äôt even want to pay what you charged me for all the aggravation I had yesterday. Trust me, Uber will not be my first choice next time. Risa Yudkowitz

title: Horrible
text: Make sure you don‚Äôt leave anything on the uber because you will never see that item again and Uber is no help at all. My bag was mistakenly left in the Uber and I quickly realized not even 2 min after the Uber had left. I used the prompts on the app and reached out to the driver right away. I called several times only to get a voice mail. Shortly after I called again to hear that there number was no longer available. I followed the prompts once again leaving a description of the item and a contact number. There should be a customer service number to the app so that in case of emergencies, such as this one, they can contact the driver immediately. Uber apparently only sent the driver out an email regarding the situation! This is absolutely unacceptable. We are on vacation and now my identification is gone. This situation could have been taken care of quickly, if the company had any clue what they are doing. I emailed them two separate times only to receive automated messages in return. I highly recommend using any other means of transportation. I would have given them less than one star if it were possible.

title: Uber are criminals.
text: I have being using Uber for a couple of years. To start I notice their fares have gone up about 30% in the last year. I have had many issues with drivers( couldn‚Äôt drive, couldn‚Äôt reverse, a driver who was high and kept missing the turn off, a Jesus preacher and on and on). Lately their scam seems to be cancellation fees and wait time fees. Last night the driver went to the wrong address to pick me up,the app showed him a minute away. He never entered that he had arrived because he probably couldn‚Äôt when he was at the wrong address. I was charged $1.68 for wait time. I asked the driver about why he went to the wrong address and he became aggressive and offensive. A few weeks ago I received a call from a driver at 2 am. I was asleep in bed. He said he was waiting outside for me at an address that was three miles away. I never even ordered an Uber. I was charged a $7 cancellation fee. On both occasions Uber refused the refund and customer service refuses to answer my email. Uber was once a great idea but now they are simply criminal. Their drivers have figured out how to abuse the system and literally rob customers for false charges.

title: Uber is a rip off
text: Uber drivers barely make half of the amounts ur paying not fair basicallyin my mind come in big business shame on u everyone needs to make money and be safe however ur rates are still the same as during covid and now even higher than before now it isnt even being given anything to drivers it's just that most people expect more to go to the drivers plus they have it impossible to actually get ahold of customer service especially when they over charge u for toll roads and fees that weren't justifiable by the trips and unless u go thru with a fine tooth comb for not even a months time i was over h charged $300 by "uber"  so im disgusted with even having to look thru all of my bank statements and my rides bc of this and bank backing me 100% on this action im not using they have decent drivers but u shouldnt be charged for toll roads or waiting time fees bc the driver doesnt hit the picked the riders up button as soon as u get in the car or something and then its on u to pay the fees so dont think ur being nice letting them text or continue the call theyre on bc ur paying for it not them

title: Riders Beware, surge pricing is brutal
text:
Uber is a great ridesharing app but you should be prepared to have other options. 

I am a avid user of ride sharing apps with over 200+ rides with Uber since starting. 

The problem is they get really greedy with the pricing. Ask any driver and have an open discussion about the cost of the trip vs what the driver makes and you will find a big disparity in what you pay vs what the drivers make.

The other red flag with Uber is how they handle spot pricing. If you call an Uber right before a surge pricing event occurs in your area you are immediately deprioritized from nearby drivers and the app will force you to rebook at a higher fee. I just had this happen to me today where I agreed to pay $38 dollars to get home. After 15 minutes of waiting I cancelled the ride and looked again only to find my $38 fare was now increased to $46! Frustrated, I installed Lyft to see what the cost to go home would be and it was $33! Checked back to Uber after installing Lyft only to find Uber had completely jacked the cost of my ride home upward $60!!!! >:(

While the laws do not prevent this kind of behavior, it is sadly a common experience for people like me who depend heavily on ridesharing to get back and forth. I spend roughly $1000 a month in ridesharing alone and have come to the conclusion that the only way to avoid being ripped off is by talking about these experiences and hope this spurs others to take action as well.

title: Driver stole my phone and TERRIBLE customer support
text: My two agents Pauline and Selyn were completely rude and unprofessional. I actually have worked in customer support before and when a customer asks to be transferred to a supervisor to escalate the call the correct procedure is to transfer to a supervisor. Both agents closed the chat in my after literally offering NO SUPPORT about my item. I keep explaining the situation but they keep sending the same exact scripted messages. I have been talking to customer support for over 2 weeks in order to receive help and NOTHING. Meanwhile the driver that stole my phone doesn‚Äôt even get a slap on the wrist. All I get from Uber is ‚Äòwe tried but he‚Äôs not picking up, but we‚Äôll let you know once he picks up‚Äô FOR 2 STRAIGHT WEEKS. What kind of amateur customer support is this? At LYFT they ACTUALLY provide you with help when situations like this happen. I‚Äôve been a long time Uber costumer but it‚Äôs constantly the same issues with customer support being unhelpful. I recommend Lyft or just taking a cab for anyone that values their time and money. It baffles me that Uber buries their heads in the sand.

title: Overpriced/Uber Lies on Discounts
text: So I I‚Äôll start off by saying that I initially liked uber because it was convenient and the prices were reasonable compared to cab prices. Now, uber overcharges on fares and lies about having discounts. I had an uber pass that I paid for monthly for discounts since I was a frequent user but I found out after a while that uber doesn‚Äôt actually give a discount and if it does, it‚Äôs by a couple of cents. They inflate prices and claim it‚Äôs due to ‚Äúbeing busy‚Äù. Also, once you look up a price, you pretty much have to be ready to purchase right at that time or else the price will be increased since it‚Äôs logged that you wanna go to that desired location you just checked. Also, I am a diamond member due to the amount of points I have and I purchased a 20% discount to avoid paying an $70 fair for what‚Äôs really supposed to be $50 at most and and when I put in my desired location in again for the discount, the price stayed the same and claimed my fair was $80!

title: Stole money out of my account
text:
I purchased a ride with Uber and was charged the full amount Uber decided to go into my account and charge me an additional fee with had overdrawn the account. I use that account specifically for online purchases and only out what I need in that account for purchases so once I was double charged and the account was overdrawn my bank sent me a notification. 

I contacted Uber support through the app to inform them of their error. I was told they had to charge me again because they weren‚Äôt able to take the full amount the first time and at the end of the message it said no response needed as if they couldn‚Äôt have made an error and the conversation was over. I opened the chat back up to respond and explain how they had taken the full charge and even sent a screenshot of the statement to prove I was charged the full amount plus an additional amount. That was days ago and I have not heard from Uber since. Now I have to dispute these charges with my bank and never ride with Uber again. If you don‚Äôt like money stolen out of your account and support disregarding your concerns I suggest you do not use Uber.

title: Change price back to range
text:
I have had Uber for years and have never had the desire to review until now. First, something needs to be done when I driver cancels the trip. If I am charged a fee when I cancel a trip, then I should be given money when they cancel it because it is an EXTREME inconvenience. I was waiting for a driver for 15 minutes and when he was almost here, suddenly it was cancelled. Then I had to find another driver and wait another 15 minutes and at that point, I had missed my appointment. 
My other major critique is the new ‚Äúexact price‚Äù. This may seem like a good idea, but in practice, it is costing me more money. I no longer get charged on actual kilometers or time travelled, but instead, am given a price in the middle of the usual range and it ends up costing a lot more. A lot of times drivers take different routes or take more/less time to get to the destination than predicted. Please bring back the price range, and base trips on actual distance and time. 
If these two issues or at least one are addressed, then I will resubmit a positive review.

Thank you.

title: Uber Doesn‚Äôt Care About Its Riders
text: I have always loved Uber and had great experiences with both the drivers and customer service. This weekend I requested a ride to a destination about a mile and a half away. Somehow the driver ended up going the wrong direction and we hit a toll we shouldn‚Äôt have. I said that it seemed like we weren‚Äôt going in the right direction so when she got to the other side of the bridge she should turn around. She said she thought we were close so she already accepted another rider and would only be able to take us back on the other side of the toll. She tried to drop us off on the side of the road and the other passenger had to ask her to please pull up to the sidewalk for our safety. We had to walk close to a mile to get to the originally requested destination. I sent a note to Uber support through the app and they did not understand why I was dissatisfied or upset at all. They were only willing to refund me the toll charges even though the driver didn‚Äôt get me anywhere near my destination. I am so upset and bothered by their reaction to this unsafe situation that I do not even feel comfortable using Uber going forward.

title: Getting worse
text:
I use to love using uber but it is getting worse and worse and it is really starting to be a waste of time and money. Ive started to use Lyft and it‚Äôs better. 

Recently I would request uber and the app would change drivers a few times before a driver actually starts to head to pick up location, and even then the drivers would not actually come. I‚Äôve already had this happen twice in the last two/ three months where I would request uber wait for 20-30 minutes and while on the map it says only 10 minutes away but the driver is not moving. I try to call the driver and text him to get eta but no response. I cancel the ride and they charge me a cancellation fee. Back then it was really easy to dispute the charge or email uber. Now they make you go through a bunch of auto responses/questions that don‚Äôt actually help you with disputing the charge. So basically you‚Äôll waste time waiting AND they‚Äôll charge you a cancellation fee. When you want to email or talk to someone it is impossible. I looked on their website, signed on to the account and still can‚Äôt find any customer service contact.
